Reviews.Title: Okay camera but blurry pics
Reviews.Author: luci "luci"
Reviews.Content: Received the camera but had to return.  The photo quality was poor, blurry, and not even as good as my cell phone.  Maybe it is because of 3.1 pixel.  Anyhow returned and ordered a Canon 7.1 which is great.  Still used Amazon because of their wonderful customer service.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Robert W. Koh
Reviews.Content: the camera is a piece of junk and has been returned; quality of picture is not what I wanted for a young kid; viewing screen too small

Reviews.Title: TOY
Reviews.Author: DVD Buff
Reviews.Content: This Product is unusable for any practical purpose.  Therefore I suggest it as a TOY only.Store it right beside the hollow plastic 'fake' cell phone for the 'tots'.  It has all the features of a real camera including lights.Just do not plan on taking any usable photos.For instance--If you take a photo of a stop sign; you can tell by it's shape and color what the sign is--but you can not make out the word "Stop".  -TOO BLURRY-Press the shutter button...2 seconds later it flashes--seriously..Press the 10 second timer feature...1 second later it flashes--seriously..I even mounted it on a tripod and tested.  Still the photo quality was that of a moving object all though all was stationary.With no flash, all is too dark to identify; with flash, all is solid white--so much so that you cannot identify the target object.I once had a 35mm camera that cost $1.50 new, that used film.  It made better photos than this camera!For that matter, get a card board box, poke a hole in it--put some film into the box; place an object in front of the hole...you have a better camera than this one!!PS.  I did not return this camera.. The return shipping cost 1/2 as much as the product.  The product came in a sealed plastic pegboard envelope--the kind you have to destroy with scissors to get the product out of; meaning you might not get a refund by returning it without it's packaging!!Mitigate your losses and just send me 1/2 the cost in cash.  That way you only lose 50% instead of the whole price plus shipping.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: yo yo well
Reviews.Content: The camera is in good condition but I can't get it to work while the SD card is inserted. I don't know if I am doing something wrong.

Reviews.Title: A Nightmare
Reviews.Author: P. S. Finley
Reviews.Content: Where do I start?- Picture quality is blurry, at best (even braced).- Even turned off, batteries quickly drain.- MiniUSB port cover wears out, breaks off easily.- No local Help menu. (Buttons are not intuitive.)Some reviewers say this is only good as a toy.Personally, I think it would be cruel to gift this bad design to a child.Hence forth, I shall avoid anything Jazz like the plague.Advice: Get a real camera.

ProductInfo.Features:
Image resolution up to 2048 x 1536
Functions as a digital still, digital video, and PC camera
3 1/2" W x 2 1/2" H x 1" D
Uses SD¿ or MMC memory
Uses 3 AAA batteries
ProductInfo.Name: Jazz JDC31 3.1 Mega Pixel Digital Camera (Silver)
